010package imagingbook.lib.math;
011
012public abstract class Arithmetic {
013        
014        // machine accuracy for IEEE 754 float/double;
015        /** Tolerance used for comparing {@code float} quantities. */
016        public static final float EPSILON_FLOAT         = 1e-7f;        // 1.19 x 10^-7
017        /** Tolerance used for comparing {@code double} quantities. */
018        public static final double EPSILON_DOUBLE       = 2e-16;        // 2.22 x 10^-16
019
020        /**
021         * Returns the square of its argument.
022         * @param x argument
023         * @return square of argument
024         */
025        public static int sqr(int x) {
026                return x * x;
027        }
028        
029        /**
030         * Returns the square of its argument.
031         * @param x argument
032         * @return square of argument
033         */
034        public static long sqr(long x) {
035                return x * x;
036        }
037        
038        /**
039         * Returns the square of its argument.
040         * @param x argument
041         * @return square of argument
042         */
043        public static float sqr(float x) {
044                return x * x;
045        }
046        
047        /**
048         * Returns the square of its argument.
049         * @param x argument
050         * @return square of argument
051         */
052        public static double sqr(double x) {
053                return x * x;
054        }
055        
056        /**
057         * Integer version of the modulus operator ({@code a mod b}).
058         * Also see <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Modulo_operation">here</a>.
059         * This implementation has the same behavior as the {@code Math.floorMod(a,b)},
060         * available in Java 8 and higher.
061         * An exception is thrown if b is zero.
062         * @param a the dividend
063         * @param b the divisor
064         * @return {@code a mod b}
065         */
066        public static int mod(int a, int b) {
067                return Math.floorMod(a, b);
068        }
069        
070        // original implementation (obsolete)
071//      public static int mod(int a, int b) {
072//              if (b == 0)
073//                      return a;
074//              // a, b have the same sign OR the remainder is zero
075//        if ((long)a * b >= 0 || a % b == 0)   // or (a / b) * b == a
076//              return a - b * (a / b);
077//        else
078//              return a - b * (a / b - 1);
079//      }
080
081        
082        /**
083         * Non-integer version of modulus operator, with results identical to Mathematica. 
084         * Calculates {@code a mod b}.
085         * Also see <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Modulo_operation">here</a>.
086         * An exception is thrown if b is zero.
087         * @param a dividend
088         * @param b divisor
089         * @return {@code a mod b}
090         */
091        public static double mod(double a, double b) {
092                if (isZero(b))
093                                throw new DivideByZeroException();
094                return a - b * Math.floor(a / b);
095        }
096        
097        /**
098         * Test for zero (float version) using a predefined tolerance.
099         * Returns true if the argument's absolute value
100         * is less than {@link EPSILON_FLOAT}.
101         * @param x quantity to be tested
102         * @return true if argument is close to zero
103         */
104        public static boolean isZero(float x) {
105                return Math.abs(x) < EPSILON_FLOAT;
106        }
107        
108        /**
109         * Test for zero (float version) using a specified tolerance.
110         * Returns true if the argument's absolute value
111         * is less than the specified tolerance.
112         * @param x quantity to be tested
113         * @param tolerance the tolerance to be used
114         * @return true if argument is close to zero
115         */
116        public static boolean isZero(float x, float tolerance) {
117                return Math.abs(x) < tolerance;
118        }
119        
120        /**
121         * Test for zero (double version) using a predefined tolerance.
122         * Returns true if the argument's absolute value
123         * is less than {@link EPSILON_DOUBLE}.
124         * @param x quantity to be tested
125         * @return true if argument is close to zero
126         */
127        public static boolean isZero(double x) {
128                return Math.abs(x) < EPSILON_DOUBLE;
129        }
130        
131        /**
132         * Test for zero (double version) using a specified tolerance.
133         * Returns true if the argument's absolute value
134         * is less than the specified tolerance.
135         * @param x quantity to be tested
136         * @param tolerance the tolerance to be used
137         * @return true if argument is close to zero
138         */
139        public static boolean isZero(double x, double tolerance) {
140                return Math.abs(x) < tolerance;
141        }
142        
143        /**
144         * Test for numerical equality (double version) using a predefined tolerance.
145         * Returns true if the absolute difference of the arguments
146         * is less than {@link EPSILON_DOUBLE}.
147         * @param x first argument
148         * @param y second argument
149         * @return true if both arguments are numerically the same.
150         */
151        public static boolean equals(double x, double y) {
152                return Arithmetic.isZero(x - y);
153        }
154        
155        /**
156         * Test for numerical equality (float version) using a predefined tolerance.
157         * Returns true if the absolute difference of the arguments
158         * is less than {@link EPSILON_FLOAT}.
159         * @param x first argument
160         * @param y second argument
161         * @return true if both arguments are numerically the same.
162         */
163        public static boolean equals(float x, float y) {
164                return Arithmetic.isZero(x - y);
165        }
166        
167        //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
168        
169        public static class DivideByZeroException extends ArithmeticException {
170                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
171                private static String DefaultMessage = "zero denominator in division";
172                
173                public DivideByZeroException() {
174                        super(DefaultMessage);
175                }
176        }
177        
178        // -------------------------------------
179        
180//      public static void main(String[] args) {
181//              System.out.println(Arithmetic.mod(13, 4));
182//              System.out.println(Arithmetic.mod(13, -4));
183//              System.out.println(Arithmetic.mod(-13, 4));
184//              System.out.println(Arithmetic.mod(-13, -4));
185//              
186//              int b = 7;
187//              System.out.format("   i  -> floor |  mod\n");
188//              for (int i = -25; i < 25; i++) {
189//                      System.out.format("%4d  -> %4d  | %4d \n", i, Math.floorMod(i, b), Arithmetic.mod(i, b));
190//              }
191//      }
192
193}
